intro: Geniostoma vestitum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in wetland habitats and can thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
